column9: I started taking Voltaren about 2 mo. ago. I did not take it regularly at first and did not notice any difference. But now, taking it twice a day I can say it's truly amazing!! I never get headaches anymore and love the mobility this drug gives me. I can tell immediately when it is wearing off, so be sure and take it twice a day if your doctor tells you to. No side effects at all thus far. Great stuff!

My sciatica pain has been reduced a little bit but is still present and limits my physical activity.

column2: (Caregiver)
column9: Be very careful with this medicince. My 73 yr old father died suddenly last week due to a GI/stomach bleed. He was taking this drug for a few months for his sciatica (back pain). He was also taking an aspirin a day as most men his age do and the combination of the 2 caused the severe stomach bleed. The doctor knew my dad was taking aspirin but did not tell him to stop taking it for some reason. He also should have probably been prescribed nexium or prilosec to help protect his stomach, but he wasn't. So be careful...I would hate to see this happen to someone else!

column2: Lindy12206SoudertonPA, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I loved, loved, loved this one little pill. I could not believe the mobility and relief it gave me. I started taking in 97.  Two years ago my Rhuematologist warned me and mentioned he had taken all his patients off Voltaren and would no longer subscribe for me.  He said it was deadly.  I didnt buy into his scare tactics.  I contined to take through my family doctor saying nothing.  Last year I started with very strange and overwhelming, scary symptoms. Weakness  starting in my legs, over taking my entire body. I could feel it moving from lower body on up to finger tips. Over several months it happened more frequently and seemed to get worse. Last time it happened I took my PB and it was 210/110. I was advised to go to ER. After a couple days it occurred to me to stop the voltaren.  The episodes of severe weakness stopped completely and have not occurred again. I now know it was the drug. I really miss taking it but the risk over benefit was no longer an option.

column2: Sunshine, 55-64 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was perscribed this medicine because I have fluid in the back of my knee and pain in my tendons in my foot.  After being on this drug for just 6 days, my knee no longer hurts, my foot has improved 75%.  I also suffer from Lymphedema and often have swollen legs and feet at the end of the day.  The surprise after taking this drug is that I have not been swollen one day since starting it.  Also, where my ability to bend my knees and to kneel or bend were restricted due to fluid retention, now it is no problem.  My lower body, legs, knees and back have not felt better in years!

I've nearly forgotten my original problem (headaches) because of my heap of new problems - mostly heart and blood pressure related. My stomach felt like I had a gallon of acid in there. column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a 42 year old male and have been taking Voltaren for about 8 months now.  I have severe osteo arthritis of the hips.  This drug has worked excellent for me with no side effects!
